title: Why discourage champion mastery?

replies.body:
Because it isn't really related to champion mastery. It is tied to the system called "champion mastery".
What they use to find out if you get a chest is you having good games on a number of champions.

They have two systems. 

One which tells me "HEY PLAY THIS CHAMPION WELL AND FOR A LOT OF GAMES AND YOU'LL GET A BADGE AFTER ABOUT 50 OF 'EM!!!111!!"

The other which tells me "Dude. Play a champion and do well for a single game as them and I'll give you a Skin or Champion for free!*"

Which one seems better? I could make an argument for the sake of it that because of chances the first one is better because it's guaranteed but realistically. The second option is MUCH more enticing.

I got a  S with irelia on my second game with her because of a first time really trash Nasus. 
Now there isn't a point in playing her if I want a chest

Fuck. Hit the backspace and (because reasons) I went back. So. Starting over because RIP "Remember filled forms".

Anyway, tl;dr is that it's rather easy to get an S-rank simply because getting a solid one-off game isn't too difficult over time.

So let me get this straight.

Riot implemented a system which gives you free stuff.  (You can potentially obtain more free stuff if you play some other champions for 15-20 games each, hell maybe you might like one or two)

But you are complaining that getting more free stuff is too much work.

{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} 

That aside, riot said themselves that if you want a specific skin then getting it with rp will always be easier.  If you don't want to play more champions then don't.  

Play what you enjoy  and if you want a skin for your main then buy it and then enjoy using the skin. I only play like 20 or so champs and I only have a rank 5 with like 5 or 6 of them.

I think you are missing part of the point. 

In order to get free stuff you have to give up actually mastering champs, but the mastery system is directly tied to part of the drop system. The other side of the drop system is tired solo to wins. 

Therefore in order to get free stuff you have to abandon mastering a small pool of champs or even mastering any of the champs. 

The system is literally giving mixed messages to players. Get better to earn free stuff, you got free stuff (probably not a master of X) go play something else now to earn more.

Sure you could twist it about people getting free things, but a greater topic about the phlio and msg of the system can be done.

I understand completely. But the system is poorly designed unless it was purposefully made to give out rewards that no one actually cares about. "Oh cool, a skin for Fizz. Sure, I'll play Fizz a game."

And I'm not calling them casuals or anything. But I do know that whenever I want to actually get better at League jumping around between champions (even a small pool of 6) is counter-productive because I only play(ed) League once, sometimes twice a day. So I had a choice to either focus on the game or focus on the champions. I chose to focus on the game. This system exists to send the message that my choice is the wrong one despite it CLEARLY being the proper choice when it comes to getting better at the game.

Correct me if im wrong but here is what i understood so far.
I have 2 champions, diana = level 5 mastery and akali = no mastery
trying to obtain an S on diana is way harder to do than trying to obtain it on akali?
Am i getting this right?

Can someone put this into simpler terms for me? like make an example.

Having mastery on a champion doesn't make getting an S grade any easier or difficult.

Much like school, having an A overall doesn't affect your upcoming grade on a project. Nor does having an F.
